thread.title: 49ers won’t raise season-ticket prices for next two seasons
thread.title_full: 49ers won’t raise season-ticket prices for next two seasons

author: Eric Branch
title: 49ers won’t raise season-ticket prices for next two seasons
text: By Eric Branch , San Francisco Chronicle Updated 12:40 pm, Tuesday, January 24, 2017 Photo: Jeff Chiu, Associated Press Image 1 of / 10 Close Image 1 of 10 Fans walk into Levi's Stadium before a game between the San Francisco 49ers and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Santa Clara, Calif., Sunday, Oct. 23, 2016. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu) Fans walk into Levi's Stadium before a game between the San Francisco 49ers and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Santa Clara, Calif., Sunday, Oct. 23, 2016. (AP Photo/Jeff Chiu) Photo: Jeff Chiu, Associated Press Image 2 of 10 Click ahead to see all the reasons why Jed York can't fix the 49ers. Click ahead to see all the reasons why Jed York can't fix the 49ers. Photo: Paul Chinn, The Chronicle Buy this photo Image 3 of 10 7. Eddie DeBartolo Jr. knew he didn't know football. That's why he hired the best football minds he could find. Does the current management and ownership share the same approach? 7. Eddie DeBartolo Jr. knew he didn't know football. That's why he hired the best football minds he could find. Does the current management and ownership share the same approach? Photo: Eric Risberg, Associated Press Image 4 of 10 Buy photo 6. Jed York and Paraag Marathe are not known as great communicators. Will they be able to recognize communication skills in those they hire? 6. Jed York and Paraag Marathe are not known as great communicators. Will they be able to recognize communication skills in those they hire? Photo: Gabrielle Lurie, The Chronicle Buy this photo Image 5 of 10 5. The Yorks, including Jed's father John, have hired several head coaches - Dennis Erickson, Mike Nolan, Mike Singletary, Jim Harbaugh, Jim Tomsula, and Chip Kelly. Only one of them, Harbaugh, was able to steer the team into the playoffs. less 5. The Yorks, including Jed's father John, have hired several head coaches - Dennis Erickson, Mike Nolan, Mike Singletary, Jim Harbaugh, Jim Tomsula, and Chip Kelly. Only one of them, Harbaugh, was able to ... more Photo: Paul Chinn, The Chronicle Image 6 of 10 4. York said he wants the general manager and the head coach to be in constant and productive communication. But will that mean he will back away? 4. York said he wants the general manager and the head coach to be in constant and productive communication. But will that mean he will back away? Photo: Associated Press Image 7 of 10 3. York was reportedly extremely close to former general manager Trent Baalke, which led to him being kept too long. Will York make the same mistake again? 3. York was reportedly extremely close to former general manager Trent Baalke, which led to him being kept too long. Will York make the same mistake again? Photo: Peter Earl McCollough, Special To The Chronicle Image 8 of 10 2. While York said he will consult a number of unnamed experts, it appears none of them will be brought in full time. The 49ers will not be hiring the Warriors' version of Jerry West. 2. While York said he will consult a number of unnamed experts, it appears none of them will be brought in full time. The 49ers will not be hiring the Warriors' version of Jerry West. Photo: Stephen Dunn, Getty Images Image 9 of 10 1. The same pair, Jed York and Paraag Marathe, that helped hire Mike Nolan and every successive coach and general manager since, will be conducting the search for the new general manager and head coach. The pair do not inspire confidence in much of the fan base.
